name: Snowbird
text: Creature forms enter play facedown. Great Beasts - Action: Spend a resource of any type → flip each faceup creature form. Then, choose a facedown creature form and flip it. Snowbird gains each TRAIT on that creature form.

name: Narya
text: Creature forms enter play facedown. Demigoddess - Response: After Narya heals, for each point of excess damage healed beyond her maximum hit points, heal 1 damage from a friendly character.

flavor: "There is a richness to life that ou have not yet begun even to suspect, Narya. Do not deny yourself this fullness."
name: Shaman
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Shaman and deal 1 damage to him → draw 1 card.

flavor: "Sasquatch is not the only one with strength"-Snowbird
name: Artic Assault
text: Hero Action (attack): Deal 5 damage to an enemy. Resolve Snowbird's "Great Beasts" ability for free. Deal damage to an enemy equal to your ATK.

flavor: "You have made a grave mistake."-Snowbird
name: Boreal Boost
text: Hero Action: (thwart): Remove 4 threat from a scheme. Resolve Snowbird's "Great Beasts" ability for free. Remove X threat from a scheme, where X is equal to your THW.

name: Fluid Formation
text: Hero Action: Resolve Snowbird's "Great Beasts" ability for free. Draw X cards, where X is equal to your THW

name: Heavy Hide
text: Hero Action (defense): When you would take any amount of damage, resolve Snowbird's "Great Beasts" ability for free. Reduce the amount of damage taken by X, where X is equal to your DEF.

flavor: "it's a beauty way to go." -Puck
name: Great White North
text: Hero Resource: Exhaust Great White North → generate the resource on the faceup creature form. If the printed resource on the card you are playing is the same resource, generate 2 of that resource instead.

name: Bear
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 THW, +1 DEF and retaliate 1. response: After you play a DEFENSE card, exhaust Bear → draw 1 card.

name: Bear
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 THW, +1 DEF and retaliate 1. response: After you play a DEFENSE card, exhaust Bear → draw 1 card.

name: Dinosaur
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 ATK, +1 DEF and her attacks gain piercing Hero Action: Exhaust Dinosaur → reduce the cost of the next ATTACK card you play this round by 1.

name: Dinosaur
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 ATK, +1 DEF and her attacks gain piercing Hero Action: Exhaust Dinosaur → reduce the cost of the next ATTACK card you play this round by 1.

name: Human
text: Setup. Creature form.This card cannot be discarded. Enters play faceup. Narya gets + 1 hand size. Hero Action: Exhaust Human → Search your deck for a creature form and add it to your hand.

name: Human
text: Setup. Creature form.This card cannot be discarded. Enters play faceup. Narya gets + 1 hand size. Hero Action: Exhaust Human → Search your deck for a creature form and add it to your hand.

name: Owl
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets +1 THW, +1 ATK and ignores guard and patrol. Hero Action: Exhaust Owl → reduce the cost of the next THWART card you play this round by 1.

name: Owl
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets +1 THW, +1 ATK and ignores guard and patrol. Hero Action: Exhaust Owl → reduce the cost of the next THWART card you play this round by 1.

name: Seal
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 ATK, +1 DEF and gains agile 1. Hero Action: Exhaust Seal → reduce the cost of the next TACTIC card you play this round by 1.

name: Seal
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 ATK, +1 DEF and gains agile 1. Hero Action: Exhaust Seal → reduce the cost of the next TACTIC card you play this round by 1.

name: Wendigo
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 THW, +1 ATK and her attacks gain overkill. Hero Action: Exhaust Wendigo → reduce the cost of the next MYSTIC card you play this round by 1.

name: Wendigo
text: Creature form. Snowbird gets -1 THW, +1 ATK and her attacks gain overkill. Hero Action: Exhaust Wendigo → reduce the cost of the next MYSTIC card you play this round by 1.

name: Don't Get Stuck!
text: Permanent. Setup. Forced Response: After the villain phase ends, place a permanence counter on your faceup creature form. Then, if there are 4 permanence counters on it, flip this card. Force Interrupt: When you flip this car of flip a creature form facedown, remoce each permance counter from it.

name: Stuck!
text: You cannot resolve Snowbird's "Great Beasts" ability. Your faceup creature form and stuck! gain permanent. When Revealed: Summon each non permanent creature form and remove them from the game. Treat each number 1 on the faceup creature card as a number 2 instead.

flavor: "Just in time for the fun to begin!" - Vindicator
name: Vindicator
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT trait. Toughness. Vindicator gets retaliate 2 while she 3 or more remaining hit points.

name: Aurora
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT or X-MEN trait. Companion. Fleeting. Response: After Aurora enters or leaves play, deal 1 damage to an enemy.

name: Captain Marvel
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT trait. [star] Interrupt: When Captain Marvel attacks, choose up to X enemies, where X is equal to the number of AERIAL characters you control → deal 2 damage to each chosen enemy.

flavor: "And STAY out, eh!" -Guardian
name: Guardian
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT trait. Toughness. Guardian gets +1 THW ans +1 ATK while he has 3 or more remaining hit points.

flavor: "The next time they try and break someone, they'll remember they're pretty fragile too." -Marrina
name: Marrina
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT trait. Response: After an enemy attacks Marrina, stun that enemy.

name: Nothstar
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT or X-MEN trait. Companion. Fleeting. Response: After Aurora enters or leaves play, remove 1 threat from a scheme.

flavor: "I was BORN ready! Sakkatchewan steel coming through!" -Puck
name: Puck
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT trait. Reduce the amount of damage Puck takes from eac attack by 1..

name: Sasquatch
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT or GAMMA trait. [star] If you paid for this card using only [mental] resources, your hero gets +1 hand size untl Sasquatch leaves play. If you paid for this card using only [physical] resources, Sasquatch gets +3 ATK.

flavor: "The spirits defer to my presence." -Shaman
name: Shaman
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT or MYSTIC trait. Hero Action: Exhaust Shaman → draw 1 card. If that card is an aspect or basic card, deal 1 damage to him.

name: Snowbird
text: Play only if your identity as the ALPHA FLIGHT or MYSTIC trait. Response: After Snowbird enters play, choose one: . Snowbird gets +1 ATK and her attacks gain piercing, . Snowbird gets + 2 hit points and gains retaliate 2, . Snowbird gets +1 THW and gains the AERIAL trait.

name: Michael Twoyoungmen
text: Setup: Summon Shaman's Medicine Pouch and add it to your hand. [star] Medicine Man — Damage you heal using your basic recovery can be divided among your identity and 1 additional character as you choose.

flavor: “Deep meditation will be required to understand this fully.”
name: Shaman
text: Mystic Mastery — Hero Action: Exhaust Shaman → draw 1 card.

name: Snowbird
text: Interrupt: When Snowbird exhausts, place or remove 1 shift counter from here. While the shift counters here are equal to (X), she gets: (1) +2 ATK and her attacks gain piercing. (2) +3 hit points and gains retaliate 2. (3) +2 THW and gains the [[AERIAL]] trait.

flavor: “Synchronicity is a major component of magic.” —Shaman
name: Astral Form
text: Hero Interrupt (defense): When the villain would deal damage to Shaman, confuse them instead.

flavor: “Great Spirit, guide me!” —Shaman
name: Commune
text: Hero Action: Ready a [[MYSTIC]] card.

flavor: “Deep in your heart, you know this is wrong.” —Shaman
name: Entangle
text: Hero Action (attack): Stun and deal 3 damage to an enemy. If a minion was stunned this way, ready Shaman.

flavor: “The soul, too, can be cured.” —Shaman
name: Mystic Healing
text: Hero Action: Heal 1 damage and remove a status card from a character. If a status card was removed this way, ready Shaman.

name: Mystic Dust
text: Hero Response: After you spend this card on a [[SPELL]] event, remove 1 threat from a scheme or ready Shaman.

name: Eaglet
text: Attach to a main scheme. Increase the target threat value of attached scheme by 4. Hero Interrupt: When Shaman would remove any amount of threat from attached scheme, remove 1 additional threat.

name: Refreshing Winds
text: Shaman gains the [[AERIAL]] trait. Hero Response: After Shaman defeats a minion or side scheme, ready him. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Shaman's Medicine Pouch
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Shaman's Medicine Pouch and discard a [[SPELL]] card from your hand → choose two: * Play a [[SPELL]] card from your discard pile (paying its cost) * Deal 1 damage to an enemy * Heal 1 damage from a character

name: Spirit Staff
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Spirit Staff → place a spirit counter on a card (to a maximum of 2 per card). Interrupt: When you use a basic power against a card with X spirit counters on it, you get +X to that power for this use.

flavor: “Paging Dr. Twoyoungmen.”
name: Code Blue
text: Give to the Michael Twoyoungmen player. You cannot ready. Alter-Ego Action: Discard each [[SPELL]] card or printed [mental] resource from your hand. If 3 or more cards were discarded this way, remove Code Blue from the game.

name: Walter Langkowski
text: Strategy — Forced Response: After the player phase begins, choose either [mental] or [physical] as your "Strategy" resource type. Action: Discard a card from your hand → if your "Strategy" resource type is [mental], draw 1 card. If it is [physical], ready Walter Langkowski. (Limit once per round.)

name: Sasquatch
text: Strategy — Forced Response: After the player phase begins, choose either [mental] or [physical] as your "Strategy" resource type. [star] While your "Strategy" resource type is: * [mental] - You get +1 THW. * [physical] - You get +1 ATK.

name: Puck
text:
While your "Strategy" resource type is:
. [mental] - Puck cannot take consequential damage.
. [physical] - Puck cannot take damage from minion attacks.

flavor: “I don't have time to mess around here.” —Sasquatch
name: Northern Exposure
text: Hero Action: Choose up to 3 different enemies. Place a different status card on each of them.

name: Rushing Blow
text: You can only spend your "Strategy" resource type to pay for this card. Hero Action (attack/thwart): Deal damage to an enemy equal to your ATK or remove threat from a scheme equal to your THW.

flavor: “Squatch smash puny Canadians!” —Sasquatch
name: Squatch Smash
text: Hero Interrupt: When you use a basic power, you get +6 for that use. If you paid for this card using only your "Strategy" resource type, draw 1 card.

flavor: “I feel fine. Seriously.” —Walter Langkowski
name: Unstoppable Farce
text: Hero Action: Ready Sasquatch. If you paid for this card using only your "Strategy" resource type, draw 1 card.

name: Limitless Potential
text: Hero Interrupt: When you spend this card, treat it as if it has 3 printed resources of your "Strategy" resource type instead.

flavor: “Ever been hit by a Gamma Bomb, Jackie? It's a trip.” —Walter Langkowski
name: Walter's Lab
text: Walter Langkowski gets +2 REC. Alter-Ego Resource: Exhaust Walter's Lab → generate either a [mental] resource or a [physical] resource.

flavor: “Did you say 'furious' or 'furriest'?” —Puck
name: Boundless Fury
text: Hero form only. Sasquatch gets +1 THW, +1 ATK, and +1 DEF. Forced Response: After you change form, discard this card.

flavor: “Turn around and back away.” —Sasquatch
name: Immovable Subject
text:
You get +4 hit points.
Sasquatch gains retaliate 1.

flavor: “The Collective wiped 'em out. Only Walt lived.”
name: Survivor's Guilt
text: Give to the Walter Langkowski player. Choose: . You are stunned. Discard this obligation. . You are confused. Discard this obligation.

flavor: “Vowed to live an interesting life. I've done okay.”
name: Eugene Judd
text: Extended Longevity — Response: After you recover, choose to either ready Eugene Judd or give him a tough status card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: “Aren't I just the luckiest little super-hero?”
name: Puck
text: [star] Rebounding — Hero Response: After Puck uses a basic power, ready him. Then, he gets -1 THW, -1 ATK, and -1 DEF until the end of the phase.

flavor: “Let's discuss our options, Eugene.”
name: Sasquatch
text: Action: Exhaust Sasquatch → Puck gains the [[AERIAL]] trait until the end of this turn. Reduce the cost of the next [[TACTIC]] or [[AERIAL]] card you play this round by 1.

flavor: “Losing a bit of your edge, eh?” —Puck
name: Boing!
text: Hero Interrupt: When Puck would take 1 or more damage, reduce that amount by X. If you take no damage this way, stun or confuse an enemy.

name: Bounce Around
text: Hero Action (attack/thwart): Choose to either deal damage to an enemy equal to your ATK or remove threat from a scheme equal to your THW. If a minion or side scheme was defeated this way, return this card to your hand. (Limit once per round per copy.)

flavor: “I don't think so. Now, let's get to work, eh!” —Puck
name: Glance
text: Hero Interrupt: When Puck would take up to 3 damage, give him a tough status card instead.

flavor: “Small. Fast. Tough. Also, I'm a big hockey fan.” —Puck
name: Ultra Durable
text: Hero Action: Give Puck a tough status card. If he is already tough, he gets +1 THW, +1 ATK, and +1 DEF until the end of the round instead.

name: Compressed Physiology
text: Puck ignores the piercing keyword. Hero Interrupt: When a tough status card is discarded from Puck, draw 1 card.

name: Double Down
text: Puck gets +1 DEF. Hero Interrupt: When a tough status card is discarded from Puck while resolving the effects of an enemy attack, deal 1 damage to the attacker.

flavor: Eugene's achondroplasia causes daily pain.
name: Push Through
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Push Through → take 1 damage. Puck gets +1 THW or +1 ATK until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

name: Surreptitious
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Surreptitious → Puck's next basic power ignores the guard and patrol keywords and crisis icons ([per_hero]). Action: Discard Surreptitious → ready your identity.

name: Achondroplasty
text: Give to the Eugene Judd player. You may flip to alter-ego form. You cannot ready your identity. Alter-Ego Action: Discard a tough status card from your identity → remove Achondroplasty from the game.

name: Heather Hudson
text: Dedicated — Action: Spend a [mental] resource → search your deck for a hero-specific ally or upgrade and add it to your hand. If Guardian is already in play, place 1 charge counter on him and 1 charge counter on Heather Hudson.

name: Vindicator
text: Vindicator cannot have more than 4 charge counters here. Vindicated — Response: After you heal any amount of excess damage from Vindicator, place up to that amount of charge counters here.

name: Guardian
text: Guardian gets +1 ATK for each charge counter here. Response: After Guardian uses a basic power, place 1 charge counter here. If there are 4 or more charge counters here, shuffle Guardian into your deck.

name: All of Us Command
text: Alliance. Hero Action: Remove 1 charge counter from Guardian or Vindicator for each [[ALPHA FLIGHT]] character in play → draw 1 card for each charge counter removed this way.

flavor: “Hang on, Mac! I'll be right with you.” —Heather Hudson
name: Patriot Love
text: Action: Ready your identity. Then, if you are in hero form, you may place 1 charge counter on Guardian or Vindicator.

flavor: “It's alright. I've got you.” —Vindicator
name: Serve and Protect
text: Hero Interrupt (thwart): When you use a basic power, remove 4 threat from a scheme. If it is during the villain phase, heal 2 damage from your identity.

flavor: “Surprise, jackass!” —Vindicator
name: Unexpected Blast
text: Hero Interrupt (attack): When you exhaust to use a basic power, deal 4 damage to an enemy. If it is during the villain phase, confuse the villain.

name: Anti-Gravity Generation
text: Hero Response: After you spend this card, heal 2 damage from Vindicator.

flavor: “Come in, Department H. This is Vindicator.” —Vindicator
name: Department H
text: Action: Exhaust Department H → look at the top 2 cards of any deck. If you looked at your deck this way, add 1 of those cards to your hand and discard 1 card from your hand.

name: Concussive Beams
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Concussive Beams and remove up to 2 charge counters from Vindicator → you gain retaliate X until the end of the round, where X is equal to the number of charge counters removed this way.

name: Energy Redirection
text: Hero Response: After you play a [[SUPERPOWER]] event, remove 1 charge counter from Vindicator → choose: * Add a copy of Anti-Gravity Generation from your discard pile to your hand. * Ready Vindicator.

flavor: “Heather, this new power source is 50% more effective than the old model!” —Guardian
name: Improved Power Cell
text:
Attach to Guardian or Vindicator.
Treat each printed number "4" on attached character's card as a "6" instead.

name: Vindicator's Helmet
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Vindicator's Helmet and discard the top card of the encounter deck. Then, take X damage, where X is equal to the number of boost icons ([boost]) on that card → Vindicator gets +X THW or +X ATK or +X DEF until the end of the round.

name: Care for Claire
text: Give to the Heather Hudson player. You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose: * Exhaust Heather Hudson → remove Care for Claire from the game. * Choose and discard 1 card from your hand. You cannot change form until your next turn ends. Discard this obligation.

name: James Hudson
text: Department H — Forced Response: After you change to this form, remove each charge counter from here. Shuffle a Guardian card from your discard pile into your deck for each charge counter discarded this way.

name: Guardian
text: Charge — Special: Discard the top card of the encounter deck and place X charge counters here, where X is equal to the number of boost ([boost]) and star ([star]) icons on it. Then, if there are 4 or more charge counters here, take 1 damage and remove 2 charge counters from here.

name: Vindicator
text: Vindicator gets +1 ATK for each charge counter here. Forced Interrupt: When 4 or more charge counters are here, discard Vindicator. Response: After Guardian uses a basic power, move a charge counter from Guardian to here.

name: All of Us Command
text: Alliance. Hero Action: Remove 1 charge counter from Guardian or Vindicator for each ALPHA FLIGHT character in play → draw 1 card for each charge counter removed this way.

flavor: "It's time to seize our opportunity." —Guardian
name: From Far and Wide
text: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 3 threat from a scheme. Resolve Guardian's "Charge" ability. Then, remove 1 threat from a scheme for each charge counter on Guardian.

flavor: "...Ultimately it was not that we succeeded or failed, it was that we tried." —Guardian
name: Patriot Love
text: Action: Ready your identity. Then, if you are in hero form, you may place 1 charge counter on Guardian or Vindicator.

flavor: "And stay out, eh?" —Guardian
name: True North Strong
text: Hero Action (attack): Resolve Guardian's "Charge" ability. Then, deal 4 damage to an enemy. Deal 1 additional damage to that enemy for each charge counter on Guardian.

flavor: "Not this time, fella." —Guardian
name: Stand on Guard
text: Hero Interrupt (defense): When the villain initiates an attack against you, remove 2 charge counters from Guardian → cancel that attack and stun the villain.

name: Glowing Heart
text: Hero Response: After you spend this card, resolve Guardian's "Charge" ability.

flavor: "I'm flying this time, Walter." —Guardian
name: Omnijet
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Omnijet → resolve Guardian's "Charge" ability or place a charge counter on Vindicator.

flavor: "Heather, this new power source is 50% more effective than the old model!" —Guardian
name: Improved Power Cell
text:
Attach to Guardian or Vindicator.
Treat each printed number "4" on attached character's card as a "6" instead.

flavor: Guardian's suit has a neural connection allowing him to allocate power where needed.
name: Guardian's Suit
text: Guardian gets +1 ATK, +1 THW, and +1 DEF for every 2 charge counters on him.

name: Department H
text: Give to the James Hudson player. You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose: • Exhaust James Hudson → remove Department H from the game. • Take 2 damage and remove each charge counter on Guardian. Discard this obligation.

name: Jean-Paul Beaubier
text: Damage is shared between your active identity and your set-aside identity. Setup: Set the Jeanne-Marie Beaubier identity card aside. Toute Suite — Response: After Jean-Paul Beaubier enters play, remove 1 threat from a scheme.

name: Northstar
text: Damage is shared between your active identity and your set-aside identity. Agile 1. Reflex — Response: After Northstar makes a basic defense, remove 1 threat from a scheme. If this removes the last threat on that scheme, ready him.

name: Jeanne-Marie Beaubier
text: Damage is shared between your active identity and your set-aside identity. "Je Reviens!" — Response: After Jeanne-Marie Beaubier enters play, deal 1 damage to a character.

name: Aurora
text: Damage is shared between your active identity and your set-aside identity. Agile 1. Reflects — Response: After Aurora makes a basic defense, deal 1 damage to an enemy. If that enemy is defeated this way, ready her.

name: Aurora
text: Permanent. Setup. This card's printed text box cannot be treated as if it were blank. [star] Aurora cannot defend, take damage, or have upgrades attached to her. Response: After Aurora enters play, deal 1 damage to an enemy.

name: Northstar
text: Permanent. This card's printed text box cannot be treated as if it were blank. [star] Northstar cannot defend, take damage, or have upgrades attached to him. Response: After Northstar enters play, remove 1 threat from a scheme.

flavor: "Northstar, don't just stand there!" —Aurora
name: Toujours en Mouvement
text: Hero Action: Choose two: • Ready Aurora. • Ready Northstar. • Ready the Supersonic upgrade.

name: Dépêche Toi !
text: Hero Action: Choose one: • Exhaust Northstar → remove 3 threat from a scheme. • Exhaust Aurora → deal 3 damage to an enemy. • Exhaust Aurora and Northstar → draw 3 cards.

flavor: "Time to show them what the Beaubier twins can do, mon frère." —Aurora
name: Gestalt Photokinesis
text: Hero Action: Exhaust Aurora and Northstar → stun and confuse the villain and each minion engaged with you.

name: Multiple Personalities
text: Action: Exhaust Aurora and discard the top card of your deck. If its printed resource is: [energy] - Deal 1 damage to each enemy engaged with you. [mental] - Remove 2 threat from each scheme. [physical] - Deal 3 damage to an enemy. [wild] - Resolve all of the above.

flavor: "I searched everywhere, Kyle. Literally." —Northstar
name: X-Factor Investigation
text: Action: Look at the top 4 cards of any deck and put them back in any order. Then, if the top two cards of that deck are the same card type, ready Northstar and draw 1 card.

flavor: "Without Aurora -- without our special partnership -- there is little to bind me to the team." —Northstar
name: French Connection
text: Hero Resource: Exhaust French Connection → generate the printed resource of your signature ally.

flavor: "Shall we give that another go?" —Northstar
name: Rerun
text: Hero Action: Discard Rerun → shuffle each Aurora & Northstar event you played this turn into your deck. If 2 or more cards were shuffled this way, ready a card you control.

name: Supersonic
text: Hero Interrupt: When Aurora or Northstar would resolve an ability on their character card or a use a basic power, exhaust Supersonic → treat a printed number "1" on that card as if it were a printed number "2" for that use.

name: Tag Team!
text: Permanent. Setup. Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Tag Team! → swap your identity with the set-aside identity, flip your signature ally, and ready each of them. Then, swap all encounter cards and status cards attached to your signature ally with all encounter cards and status cards attached to your identity.

name: Different Lives
text: Give to the Aurora & Northstar player. You cannot exhaust your signature ally. Alter-Ego Action: Spend 3 resources of the same resource type as your signature ally → remove Different Lives from the game.
